narrative.title: Superga Division - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: Italian Assault and Landing Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: Assault and Landing Division - Specialized in combined operations, amphibious assaults, and mountain warfare. Trained at Leghorn (Italian combined operations center) and Gaeta. One of only three Italian assault divisions (with 4th Livorno and 20th Friuli).
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Tunisia - mixed coastal plains, hills, and mountainous terrain (Dorsale Mountains)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Decentralized heavy weapons (battalion-level control vs regimental)

environment.terrain_type: Tunisia - mixed coastal plains, hills, and mountainous terrain (Dorsale Mountains)
